gcci.text: H100 pricing at $3.14/hr signals persistent supply constraints and capital intensity, as GPU scarcity forces operators to pay premium rates that could incentivize $100B+ capex cycles to expand capacity.

gtpi.text: Token pricing at $1.38/1M inputs reflects aggressive API price compression as providers like DeepSeek undercut incumbents to capture market share, driving 60-80% cost reductions that favor efficiency-optimized models.

gagl.text: 120 TWh annual load represents a 25-30% increase in power consumption, creating grid stability challenges that accelerate nuclear adoption discussions and pressure AI firms toward carbon-neutral commitments.

aipi.text: The convergence of $3.14/hr GPU costs, $1.38/1M token pricing, and 120 TWh energy demand suggests unsustainable growth dynamics where margin compression meets infrastructure strain, creating bubble risk if scaling continues unchecked.
